translated: Due to the non-ascertainment of the reason itself, there is the fallacy of the reason being unestablished.🔽Due to the non-ascertainment of the pervasion, there is the fallacy of the reason being inconclusive.

analyzed: eteṣām ca aniścayaḥ sandehāt vā
translated: And the non-ascertainment of these is either due to doubt,

original: abhāvaniścayād veti na kaścit phalaṃ prati viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: abhāva niścayāt vā iti na kaścid phalam prati viśeṣaḥ
translated: or due to the ascertainment of non-existence. Thus there is no difference in the result.

original: etena vyomapadmāṃ sugandhi padmātvāt ityādayo 'pi saṃgṛhītā bhavanti /
analyzed: etena sugandhi padmā tvāt ityādayaḥ pi saṃgṛhītāḥ bhavanti
translated: By this, even the fallacies like The sky-lotus is fragrant, because it is a lotus, etc. are included.

analyzed: anyathā yaḥ pakṣe san iti lakṣaṇena etat labhyate
translated: Otherwise, what is not in the subject is obtained by the definition.

original: yathā hi / asati sapakṣe vipakṣe ca pratiṣedhaḥ kartu na śakyate /
analyzed: yathā hi asati sapakṣe vipakṣe ca pratiṣedhaḥ kartu na śakyate
translated: For just as a negation cannot be made without a similar instance and a contrary instance,

analyzed: tathā pakṣe pi iti
translated: so also not even in the subject.

analyzed: satyāḥ eva iti satyena abhyupagatāyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Only when it exists means when it is accepted as existing.

analyzed: tasyāḥ nitya tva abhāvāt iti
translated: Because it is not eternal.

analyzed: tat asiddham iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this is not established, it is not so.

analyzed: kadācid upalambha lakṣaṇena api anitya tvena sādhya siddheḥ teṣām vyañjaka vaicitrye pi vyakti āśraya saṃbandhinām upalambham antareṇa anupalambha niyamāt
translated: Because the probandum is established even by impermanence characterized by occasional perception, because even in the diversity of the manifestor, those [sounds] are invariably not perceived without being perceived in relation to the substratum of the individual.

original: upalambhe vā tattvānupapatte /🔽sadopalambhaprasaṅgācca /🔽tejasābhibhūtatvāt na tatheti cetna /
analyzed: upalambhe vā tattva anupapatte  sadā upalambha prasaṅgāt ca  tejasā abhibhūta tvāt na tathā iti ced na
translated: Or if there is perception, their reality is not possible.🔽And because there would always be perception.🔽If it is argued that it is not so because it is overwhelmed by light, it is not so.

analyzed: āśraya an abhibhave teṣām an abhibhāvāt
translated: Because if the substratum is not overwhelmed, they are not overwhelmed.

analyzed: tad abhibhave tu teṣām upalambhe tad upalambha prasaṅgāt
translated: But if that is overwhelmed, then if they are perceived, their perception would follow.

analyzed: atas eva na bhā bhāvasya tad vyañjaka tvam
translated: For the same reason, the absence [of sound] is not its manifestor.

analyzed: tasmāt kadācid upalambhaḥ eva asyāḥ sāmānya avirūpa tām pratikṣipati iti
translated: Therefore, occasional perception itself rejects the non-uniformity of this universal.

analyzed: na api karma iti
translated: Nor is it action.

original: svāśrayaṃ prāgdeśād vibhajya deśāntaraṃ prāpayat karma tattāyāṃ vyavatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: sva āśrayam prāc deśāt vibhajya deśa antaram prāpayat karma tad tāyām vyavatiṣṭhate
translated: Action, which separates its substratum from the previous place and causes it to reach another place, remains in that state.

analyzed: na atas nyathā
translated: Not otherwise.

analyzed: calana vyavahārasya an ākasmika tvāt
translated: Because the usage of motion is not accidental.

analyzed: anya nimitta abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no other cause.

analyzed: evaṃbhūta artha anvaya vyatireka anuvidhānāt ca chāyāyāḥ tu āśrayaḥ eva tāvat nā upalabhyate
translated: And because of the conformity with the presence and absence of such a nature, the substratum of the shadow is not even perceived,

analyzed: prāk eva tasya viprayojana saṃprayojane iti arthaḥ
translated: much less its disjunction and conjunction with something else. This is the meaning.

analyzed: na guṇaḥ dravya asamavāyāt iti  dravya asamavetam hi adravya samavetam vā
translated: It is not a quality, because it is not inhered in a substance.🔽For what is not inhered in a substance is not inhered in a substance.

analyzed: a samavetam eva vā syāt
translated: Or it would be simply non-inherent.

analyzed: ubhayathā api vyāghātaḥ
translated: In both cases there is a contradiction in the quality.

analyzed: sāmānyavataḥ svatantrasya dravya tva āpatteḥ
translated: Because it would follow that what has a universal is a substance.

analyzed: niḥsāmānyasya guṇa lakṣaṇa vyāghātāt
translated: Because what has no universal contradicts the definition of a quality.

analyzed: sāmānyavān aguṇaḥ ityādi hi tat
translated: For it is said that what has a universal is a quality, etc.

original: guṇakarmaṇāṃ nirguṇatayā guṇasya tatra samavāyavirodhena tatsamavāye sāmānyarūpatvopapatterityarthaḥ /
analyzed: guṇa karmaṇām nirguṇa tayā guṇasya tatra samavāya virodhena tad samavāye sāmānya rūpa tva upapatteḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that because qualities and actions are without qualities, the quality there is established as having the form of a universal by the contradiction of inherence with it.

analyzed: dravya asamavāyāt iti
translated: Because it is not inhered in a substance.

original: hetuṃ sādhayatina mana iti teṣāṃ viśeṣaguṇavirahāt sāmānyaguṇo 'yaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: hetum sādhayati na manaḥ iti teṣām viśeṣa guṇa virahāt sāmānya guṇaḥ yam bhavet
translated: He proves the reason, saying not the mind, because they are devoid of special qualities, this would be a quality of a universal.

analyzed: tathā ca āśraya sahopalambha niyame tad apratyakṣa tāyām niyamāt apratyakṣa tva prasaṅgaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: And thus, in the rule of simultaneous perception with the substratum, because of the rule of its non-perception, there is the consequence of non-perception. This is the meaning.

analyzed: na api ātma guṇe iti
translated: Nor is it a quality of the self.

analyzed: iyam hi bāhya karaṇa pratyakṣa tā idantā sāmānādhikaraṇyena vyāptā
translated: For this [property of being perceptible by the external senses] is pervaded by co-inherence with the property of being this.

analyzed: tat ātma guṇatām ādāya nivartamānam anātma guṇatāyām viśrāmyati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it [the property of being perceptible by the external senses] ceases, taking with it the property of being a quality of the self, and rests in the property of being a quality of the non-self.

analyzed: na api nabhaḥ nabhasvatoḥ iti
translated: Nor is it [perceptible by the external senses] in the case of ether and air.

analyzed: cākṣuṣataḥ hi guṇānām rūpi dravya samavāyena vyāptā
translated: For the property of being perceptible by the eye is pervaded by inherence in a colored substance.

original: tacca rūpitvaṃ gaganapavanābhyāṃ vyāvartamānaṃ cākṣuṣaguṇasaṃbandhamapi vyāvartayatītyarthaḥ /🔽nāpi tejasaḥ tadguṇatvaṃ hi pratītau tadavirodhitvena vyāptam /
analyzed: tat ca rūpi tvam gagana pavanābhyām vyāvartamānam cākṣuṣa guṇa saṃbandham api vyāvartayati iti arthaḥ  nā api tejasaḥ tad guṇa tvam hi pratītau tad avirodhi tvena vyāptam
translated: And that property of being colored, ceasing in the case of ether and air, also excludes the relation of being a quality of what is perceptible by the eye. This is the meaning.🔽Nor is it [perceptible by the external senses] in the case of fire. For the property of being a quality of that [fire] is pervaded by non-contradiction with the cognition of that [fire].

analyzed: anyathā guṇinaḥ sva guṇa pratīti paripanthi tve guṇasya nitya anupalambha prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, if the quality were an obstruction to the cognition of its possessor, the quality would necessarily never be perceived.

analyzed: sati samavāye upalambha virodhāt
translated: Because if there is inherence, it contradicts perception.

analyzed: asati samavāye ca a sat tvāt
translated: And if there is no inherence, it is non-existent.

analyzed: tat ca atas nivartamānam tad guṇa tvam api nivartayati iti arthaḥ
translated: And that [property of being a quality of that], ceasing from that [fire], also excludes the property of being a quality of that [fire]. This is the meaning.

analyzed: tad sahacarita guṇa antara anupalabdheḥ ca iti
translated: And because another quality co-occurring with that is not perceived.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: na tāvat chāyā tejaso rūpametadrūpasya śuklabhāsvaratvaniyamātṛ /
analyzed: na tāvat chāyā tejasaḥ rūpam etat rūpasya śukla bhāsvara tva niyamātṛ
translated: First of all, shadow is not the color of fire, because color is restricted to being white and luminous.

analyzed: na ca indranīla prabhā rūpa vat āśrayaḥ vidhānāt
translated: And it is not the support, because it has the form of the radiance of an emerald.

analyzed: tasmāt guṇa antaram eva idam tasya iti vācyam
translated: Therefore, it must be said that this is a different quality of that.

original: tathā ca cakṣuṣopalabhyamānaṃ na rūpamanantarbhāvyopalabdhuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: tathā ca cakṣuṣā upalabhyamānam na rūpam an antar bhāvya upalabdhum śakyate
translated: And thus, the color that is perceived by the eye cannot be perceived without being included.

analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ tathā eva sāmarthya a kalanāt iti
translated: Because the eye's ability is not inferred in the same way.

analyzed: atas eva iti
translated: For this very reason.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ mātra grāhya tayā tāvat chāyā na guṇa antara tvena śaṅkā āspadam
translated: First, shadow is not a basis for doubt as a different quality, because it is perceived only by the eye.

original: rūpaṃ tu saṃbhāvyeta /🔽taccopalabhyamānaṃ pāthasa upalabhya śaityadravatvādivyāptam /
analyzed: rūpam tu saṃbhāvyeta  tat ca upalabhyamānam pāthasaḥ upalabhya śaitya drava tva ādi vyāptam
translated: But color could be suspected.🔽And that, when perceived, is pervaded by the coolness, fluidity, etc. of water, when perceived.

analyzed: a tādṛśaḥ toya tva ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for it to be water without being like that.

analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ tu upalabhya gandha ādi vyāptam
translated: But of earth, it is pervaded by smell, etc. when perceived.

analyzed: a tathābhūtasya pṛthivī tva ayogāt
translated: Because it is not possible for it to be earth without being like that.

analyzed: tat ca śaitya gandha ādi sāhacaryam atas nivartamānam anupalambhena tad guṇa tām api nivartayati iti
translated: And that is concomitant with coolness, smell, etc. Therefore, when it turns back, it turns back the quality of being its quality by non-apprehension.

analyzed: api ca iti
translated: And moreover.

analyzed: a taijasa dravya rūpa grahaṇe hi bāhya āloka vyāptasya eva cakṣuṣaḥ sāmarthyam adhigatam
translated: For when the form of a non-fiery substance is grasped, the eye's ability is understood to be pervaded only by external light.

original: na ca yatsahitasya yasya yatra sāmarthyaṃ tadrahitena tena tatkaraṇam /
analyzed: na ca yad sahitasya yasya yatra sāmarthyam tad rahitena tena tat karaṇam
translated: And when one thing has the capacity to produce another in combination with a third, it cannot produce it without that third.

analyzed: tathā sati vahni rahitam api ārdram indhanam dhūmam vidadhyāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even wet fuel devoid of fire would produce smoke, if that were so.

analyzed: virodhakaḥ tu adhikaḥ iti āha tasmin tu iti
translated: But the opponent is more, he says: But in that case, etc.

original: etena pārthivaṃ rūpamāropitaṃ tama iti nirastam /
analyzed: etena pārthivam rūpam āropitam tamaḥ iti nirastam
translated: By this, the superimposition of earth-form on darkness is refuted.

original: bāhyālokasahakārivirahe cakṣuṣastathārope 'pyasāmarthyāt tadeva hi dharmyantare vā samāropyeta pittapītimavat /
analyzed: bāhya āloka sahakāri virahe cakṣuṣaḥ tathā ārope pi asāmarthyāt tat eva hi dharmi antare vā samāropyeta pitta pītima vat
translated: Even if there is superimposition by the eye in the absence of the cooperation of external light, it is not capable of that. For that itself or another substratum would be superimposed, like the perception of yellow as blue.

original: tatraiva vā niyatadeśe 'vagamyamāne aniyatadeśatvamiti nedīyasyaṇīyasyapi mahattvavat /
analyzed: tatra eva vā niyata deśe aniyata deśa tvam iti nedīyasī aṇīyasī api mahat tva vat
translated: Or, when that is cognized as having a fixed location, it has an indefinite location, like the perception of largeness in what is near or far.

analyzed: ubhayathā api tat prathamam antareṇa anupapattiḥ ekatra āropya tvāt anyatra āropa viṣaya tvāt tasya eva
translated: In both cases, without that first, there is no possibility, because of the superimposition on one and the object of superimposition on another, of that itself.

analyzed: na ca ālokam antareṇa rūpa grahaṇe cakṣuṣaḥ sāmarthyam iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that the eye is not capable of apprehending form without light.

analyzed: na ca āropya āropa viṣaya a prathane bhrānti saṃbhavaḥ
translated: And without the manifestation of both the superimposed and the object of superimposition, there can be no illusion.

analyzed: na ca ubhayoḥ anyatarasmin avyāpṛtasya eva cakṣuṣaḥ bhrānti janaka tvam
translated: And the eye is not the producer of illusion when it is not engaged in either of the two.

analyzed: na ca ayam acākṣuṣaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: And this is not a non-visual cognition.

analyzed: tad anvaya vyatirekayoḥ ananyathāsiddha tvāt iti
translated: Because the positive and negative concomitance with that is not otherwise established.

analyzed: na api dravyam iti
translated: Nor is it a substance.

analyzed: na pṛthivī a gandha tvāt  na jalam arasa tvāt  na tejaḥ an uṣṇa tvāt
translated: It is not earth, because it lacks smell.🔽It is not water, because it lacks taste.🔽It is not fire, because it lacks heat.

analyzed: na vāyuḥ asparśa tvāt
translated: It is not air, because it lacks touch.

analyzed: na ākāśam a śabda samavāyi kāraṇa tvāt
translated: It is not space, because it is not the inhering cause of sound.

analyzed: na diś kālau paratva aparatva asamavāyi kāraṇa saṃyoga anādhāra tvāt
translated: It is not direction or time, because it is not the substratum of the inhering cause of priority and posteriority.

analyzed: na ātmā buddhi anādhāra tvāt
translated: It is not the self, because it is not the substratum of cognition.

analyzed: na manaḥ jñāna asamavāyi kāraṇa saṃyoga anādhāra tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: it is not the substratum of the inhering cause of the conjunction of cognition.

analyzed: na api anyat iti
translated: Nor is it anything else.

analyzed: na idam adravyam rūpi dravyam
translated: This is not a non-substance, because it is a visible substance.

analyzed: asmat ādi pratyakṣa tvāt
translated: Because it is perceptible to us and others.

analyzed: asmat ādi pratyakṣam hi indriyeṇa vyāptam
translated: For what is perceptible to us and others is pervaded by a sense organ.

analyzed: tat ca niyata viṣaya sāmarthyena vyāptam
translated: And that is pervaded by the capacity for a specific object.

analyzed: tat ca vipakṣāt nivartamānam indriyam nivartayat pratyakṣa tvam api nivartayati iti arthaḥ
translated: And that, turning away from the contrary, causes the sense organ to turn away, and thus causes the perceptibility to turn away as well. This is the meaning.

analyzed: asparśa tvāt iti  na idam aneka dravyam dravyam asparśa tvāt
translated: Because it lacks touch.🔽This is not a substance composed of many substances, because it lacks touch.

analyzed: asparśa tā hi dravyasya anārabhya tayā vyāptā
translated: For the quality of being untouchable is pervaded by not being composed of parts in a substance.

original: sa ca niṣedhyādanekadravyānnivartamānā svavyāpyaṃ sparśarahitatvaṃ gṛhītvā tadviparīte viśrāmyatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca niṣedhyāt aneka dravyāt nivartamānā sva vyāpyam sparśa rahita tvam gṛhītvā tad viparīte viśrāmyati iti arthaḥ
translated: And that [non-inherence] which is ceasing from many substances to be excluded, taking as its own pervasion the absence of contact, rests in the opposite of that. This is the meaning.

analyzed: anārambhaka tvena iti  a vidyamānam ārabhbhakam yasya tat tathā uktam
translated: By non-causative-ness.🔽That which does not have existent causation is said to be so.

analyzed: tasya bhāvaḥ tatvat tvam iti
translated: The state of that is non-causative-ness.

analyzed: etena āśraya asiddhiḥ parihṛtā
translated: By this, the non-establishment of the basis is refuted.

analyzed: yat tu uktam manasā dravya antara anārambhe vaiyarthyam upādhiḥ
translated: But what was said, that if the mind does not cause the production of another substance, purposelessness is the reason,

analyzed: na punar a sparśa tvam  tat kim vaiyarthyāt anārambhaka tvam unnīyate
translated: and not non-contact,🔽is that purposelessness inferred to be non-causative,

analyzed: anārambhakāt vā vaiyarthyam iti
translated: or is purposelessness from non-causative?

analyzed: na tāvat ādyaḥ
translated: First of all, not the former.

analyzed: sarva utpattimat prayojanasya asmat ādibhiḥ piśita locanaiḥ an ākalanāt
translated: Because the purpose of everything that is produced is not understood by us whose eyes are of flesh.

original: tasmād yadyārambhakasvabhāvatvaṃ manasastadā kadācidārambhe prayojanamapi kiñcid bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: tasmāt yadi ārambhaka svabhāva tvam manasaḥ tadā kadācid ārambhe prayojanam api kiñcid bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Therefore, if the mind has the nature of being causative, then at some production there will be some purpose also.

analyzed: na ced tad svabhāvaka tvam prayojana sahasreṇa api na ārambhaḥ
translated: But if it does not have that nature, then there is no production even with a thousand purposes.

analyzed: svabhāva anuvidhāyīni hi prayojanāni
translated: For purposes conform to the nature [of things].

analyzed: na tu prayojana anuvidhāyinaḥ svabhāvāḥ
translated: But natures do not conform to purposes.

original: pratyakṣabādhastu tadā syāt yadi tama evāpahnūyeta /
analyzed: pratyakṣa bādhaḥ tu tadā syāt yadi tamaḥ eva apahnūyeta
translated: But there would be contradiction with perception if darkness itself were denied.

analyzed: dravya tve pratyakṣasya a jāgaruka tvāt
translated: Because perception of substance is ever-present.

analyzed: nīlima guṇa śālinaḥ pratīteḥ
translated: Because that which possesses the quality of blueness is cognized.

analyzed: katham evam etat iti
translated: If it is asked how this is so, [the answer is:]

analyzed: vastutas sya nīla tve cākṣuṣa tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if it were blue in reality, it would follow that it is not perceived by the eye.

analyzed: āloka sahakāriṇaḥ eva cakṣuṣaḥ tatra sāmarthya avadhāraṇāt iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the eye, assisted by light, is determined to be effective in that [perception of darkness].

analyzed: śukla bhāsvara virodhi tā sāmyāt tu tathā vyavahāraḥ
translated: But the convention is based on the similarity of opposition to white and luminous things.

original: evaṃ tarhi raktādivyavahāro 'pi prasajyata iti cetna /
analyzed: evam tarhi rakta ādi vyavahāraḥ pi prasajyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that in that case the convention of red, etc. also follows, [the answer is:] no.

analyzed: vyavahāre hi sati nimitta anusmaraṇāt
translated: For when there is a convention, the cause is remembered.

original: na tu nimittāmastītyeva vyavahāraḥ yathā śaṣayoḥ śavyavahāro gauḍānāṃ varṇatvanimittāviśeṣe 'pi na kādivyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: na tu vyavahāraḥ yathā śa ṣayoḥ śa vyavahāraḥ gauḍānām varṇa tva nimitta aviśeṣe na ka ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: But the convention is not based solely on the cause, just as the Gauḍas have the convention of sa for śa even when there is no difference in the cause of the letter, but not the convention of ka and so on.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa ādi sāmagrī viśeṣāt niyamaḥ na atra api daṇḍa vāritaḥ iti
translated: The restriction is due to the special combination of unseen factors, etc., and is not prevented by the rod [of authority] in this case either.

original: tat kiṃ na kiñcidevac chāyetyata āhatasmād bhābhāva evac chāyeti /
analyzed: tat kim na kiñcid evat chāyā iti atas āha tasmāt bhā bhāvaḥ evat chāyā iti
translated: Then, is it that darkness is nothing at all? To this he says: Therefore, darkness is indeed the absence of light.

analyzed: na ca vācyam
translated: And it should not be said:

original: so 'pi kathamālokamantareṇa pratiyogismaraṇādhikaraṇagrahaṇavirahe vidhimukhena cākṣuṣo viṣaya iti /
analyzed: saḥ pi katham ālokam antareṇa pratiyogi smaraṇa adhikaraṇa grahaṇa virahe vidhi mukhena cākṣuṣaḥ viṣayaḥ iti
translated: And how can that be the object of the eye sense faculty, in the absence of light, in the absence of the apprehension of the locus of the recollection of the counter-correlate, and in the absence of the form of an injunction?

analyzed: yad grahe hi yad apekṣam cakṣuḥ tad abhāva grahe tad apekṣam eva
translated: For when there is apprehension of one thing, the eye sense faculty depends on that, even in the apprehension of its absence.

original: evaṃ hi taditarasāmagrahīsākalyaṃ syāt /🔽tadihāpyālokābhāve tadālokāpekṣā syāt /
analyzed: evam hi tad itara sāmagrahī sākalyam syāt  tat iha api āloka abhāve tad āloka apekṣā syāt
translated: For in this way, the completeness of the collection of other things would be present.🔽So here too, in the absence of light, there would be dependence on that light.

analyzed: yadi āloke tad apekṣā bhavet
translated: If there were dependence on it even in the presence of light,

analyzed: na ca etat asti
translated: and this is not the case.
